actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide States with options for providing  family planning services and supplies to individuals eligible for medical assistance  under the medicaid program.
short_title: Family Planning State Empowerment Act of 2003

summary.text: Family Planning State Empowerment Act of 2003 - Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to give States the option to elect to: (1) make available family planning services and supplies furnished to eligible individuals of child-bearing age to any individual whose family income does not exceed the greater of 185 percent of the income official poverty line applicable to a family of the size involved or the specified eligibility income level; and (2) extend the postpartum period for provision of family planning services and supplies.

titles.title: Family Planning State Empowerment Act of 2003

A bill to amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide States with options for providing  family planning services and supplies to individuals eligible for medical assistance  under the medicaid program.
